extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.jslt.JSLTTransformJSON
extension.description: Applies a JSLT transformation to the FlowFile JSON payload. A new FlowFile is created with transformed content and is routed to the 'success' relationship. If the JSLT transform fails, the original FlowFile is routed to the 'failure' relationship.

property.name: jslt-transform-transformation
property.description: JSLT Transformation for transform of JSON data. Any NiFi Expression Language present will be evaluated first to get the final transform to be applied. The JSLT Tutorial provides an overview of supported expressions: https://github.com/schibsted/jslt/blob/master/tutorial.md

property.name: jslt-transform-transformation-strategy
property.description: Whether to apply the JSLT transformation to the entire FlowFile contents or each JSON object in the root-level array

allowableValue.description: Apply transformation to entire FlowFile content JSON
Apply transformation each JSON Object in an array

property.name: jslt-transform-pretty_print
property.description: Apply pretty-print formatting to the output of the JSLT transform

property.name: jslt-transform-cache-size
property.description: Compiling a JSLT Transform can be fairly expensive. Ideally, this will be done only once. However, if the Expression Language is used in the transform, we may need a new Transform for each FlowFile. This value controls how many of those Transforms we cache in memory in order to avoid having to compile the Transform each time.

property.name: jslt-transform-result-filter
property.description: A filter for output JSON results using a JSLT expression. This property supports changing the default filter, which removes JSON objects with null values, empty objects and empty arrays from the output JSON. This JSLT must return true for each JSON object to be included and false for each object to be removed. Using a filter value of "true" to disables filtering.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid JSON), it will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: The FlowFile with transformed content will be routed to this relationship

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.
